intro: Dorstenia opifera, commonly known as the "honeyplant," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiral-shaped leaves that curl inward when touched. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing in rocky or clay soils. Dorstenia opifera is also known for its ability to exude a sticky, resinous substance from its stems.
